metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2364 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.2.1 isaffected. Safari before 10.0.3 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit"component. It allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy andobtain sensitive information via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2364` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.14.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.14.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.14.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.14.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.14.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.14.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
